@graph.caption: A stack of quinoa oatmeal raisin cookies on a white background

@graph.name: Quinoa Oatmeal Raisin Cookies ! Vegan - Vegan Richa
@graph.description: Quinoa oatmeal raisin cookies. Healthy and delicious cookies that make a perfect snack or sweet treat. Vegan Recipe.

@graph.name: Quinoa Oatmeal Raisin Cookies
@graph.description: Quinoa oatmeal raisin cookies. Healthy and delicious cookies that make a perfect snack or sweet treat. Vegan Recipe.
recipeIngredient: 3 Tablespoons Raw turbinado sugar or jaggery
2 Tablespoons roasted almond butter (Homemade nut butter recipes)
1 Tablespoon Vegan butter or Organic Canola Oil or coconut oil
4 Tablespoons quinoa (blended coarsely or quinoa flour)
2-3 Tablespoons whole wheat pastry flour (Or Rice Flour for a gluten free version)

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, mix the flax meal and hot water and let sit for a minute.
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl, mix the flax meal and hot water and let sit for a minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the room temperature almond butter, vegan butter or oil, sugar and mix well by hand or by hand mixer until the mixture feels light. The almond butter I used was store bought and it takes a while to mix up. Mix and let sit for a few minutes and then mix again to work that almond butter. I used spoon and woman hand power for the mixing!
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the room temperature almond butter, vegan butter or oil, sugar and mix well by hand or by hand mixer until the mixture feels light. The almond butter I used was store bought and it takes a while to mix up. Mix and let sit for a few minutes and then mix again to work that almond butter. I used spoon and woman hand power for the mixing!

recipeInstructions.text: Blend/grind the quinoa to a coarse flour along with the baking powder.
recipeInstructions.name: Blend/grind the quinoa to a coarse flour along with the baking powder.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in quinoa, oats, salt, cinnamon powder and lemon juice and a little wheat or rice flour and mix till just about combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in quinoa, oats, salt, cinnamon powder and lemon juice and a little wheat or rice flour and mix till just about combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in more oats and flour if needed to get gooey muffin mixture kind of consistency, Or a very sticky dough. If you added too much flour or oats and the mixture looks like a stiff dry dough, then add in a teaspoon oil and/or lemon juice to make it gooey.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in more oats and flour if needed to get gooey muffin mixture kind of consistency, Or a very sticky dough. If you added too much flour or oats and the mixture looks like a stiff dry dough, then add in a teaspoon oil and/or lemon juice to make it gooey.

recipeInstructions.text: Oil hands or tablespoon and pick up tablespoon full dough, drop them and flatten on parchment paper. Thinner the better.! Its hard to work with the sticky mixture, so I usually dont make round balls.:)
recipeInstructions.name: Oil hands or tablespoon and pick up tablespoon full dough, drop them and flatten on parchment paper. Thinner the better.! Its hard to work with the sticky mixture, so I usually dont make round balls.:)

recipeInstructions.text: Bake in preheated oven at 350 degrees F for 10-12 minutes(add minutes depending on the thickness of the cookie). The cookies should not be runny or liquidy when done.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake in preheated oven at 350 degrees F for 10-12 minutes(add minutes depending on the thickness of the cookie). The cookies should not be runny or liquidy when done.

recipeInstructions.text: Take cookies off baking tray and cool on rack for a few minutes!
recipeInstructions.name: Take cookies off baking tray and cool on rack for a few minutes!

recipeInstructions.text: Store in airtight container for a week or so. Let me know how yours turn out!
recipeInstructions.name: Store in airtight container for a week or so. Let me know how yours turn out!
